page.title: 06A CONTENTED RESIDENT
page.content: Mr. Robert Hanvey was born in Blennerhasset in 1900 and has lived there all his life. He has seen lots of changes since he was a boy. Now the school has only 24 pupils, when he went there were 126. They all wore clogs and the girls wore aprons. There was no running water in the village, the people used the three village pumps. There was no electricity either, just oil lamps and candles. Most of the people in the village were employed there, on the farms, at the nearby mine or at trades in the village. His father had a cobbler's shop there, and when he left school he worked there too. The building is still standing, but is just a storeroom today. Mr. Hanvey enjoys living in the village because it is peaceful.
